pullRequest.title: Models for team-based exercises
pullRequest.bodyText:
Checklist

 I tested all changes and all related features with different users (student, tutor, instructor, admin) on the test server https://artemistest.ase.in.tum.de.
 Server: I added multiple integration tests (Spring) related to the features
 Server: I added @PreAuthorize and check the course groups for all new REST Calls (security)
 Server: I implemented the changes with a good performance and prevented too many database calls
 Server: I documented the Java code using JavaDoc style.
 Client: I added multiple integration tests (Jest) related to the features
 Client: I added authorities to all new routes and check the course groups for displaying navigation elements (links, buttons)
 Client: I documented the TypeScript code using JSDoc style.
 Client: I added multiple screenshots/screencasts of my UI changes
 Client: I translated all the newly inserted strings into German and English

Motivation and Context
My Master's Thesis topic is "Team-based exercises in Artemis" and will add the functionality to the system that exercises can not only be solved individually but also by a team of multiple students together if the instructor choses to create a team-based exercise. This PR defines the needed models and their relationships, and is thus a very important foundation since it dictates the feature understanding and scope to some degree. It also adds some first functionality for creating exercises as team-based exercises and for managing teams for an exercise. The option to enable team mode for an exercise is only available to admin-role users for now so that none of the new functionality will be exposed to regular users for now (feature flag approach).
Model Changes

Add fields to existing entity Exercise
1.1 Add field mode (ExerciseMode: INDIVIDUAL, TEAM), default: INDIVIDUAL
1.2 Add foreign key to TeamAssignmentConfig (will be null for individual exercised and contain a TeamAssignmentConfig for team exercises)
Add new entity Team
2.1 Add fields name (team name) and image (can be used for team profile image)
2.2 Add ManyToMany relationship team_student (a student can be part of many teams and a team consists of multiple students)
2.3 Add foreign key to Exercise since teams will be defined and valid on an exercise-level for now (this might be extended in the future to support course-wide teams, more details on this in the original proposal in the "oudated" section at the bottom).
Add fields to existing entity StudentParticipation
3.1 Add foreign key team
Add new entity TeamAssignmentConfig that holds information about how the team assignment will work for a certain exercise (Right now it contains bounds for the min and max recommended time size. In the future, additional settings will likely be added.)

Data Model (UML)

Resource: Team

POST /exercises/{exerciseId}/teams - Create a new team for an exercise
PUT /exercises/{exerciseId}/teams - Update an existing team
GET /exercises/{exerciseId}/teams/{id} - Retrieve an existing team
GET /exercises/{exerciseId}/teams - Retrieve all teams for an exercise
DELETE /exercises/{exerciseId}teams/{id} - Delete a team
GET /teams?shortName={shortName} - Checks whether a team with a given shortName already exists (returns a boolean)
GET /courses/{courseId}/exercises/{exerciseId}/team-search-users - Searches for students in a course with the intent of adding them to a team for a certain exercise

Repository: Team

Set<Team> findAllByExerciseId - Returns all teams for an exercise.
Optional<Team> findOneByExerciseIdAndUserId - A student can be either in no team yet or in one team for an exercise.
Set<Team> findAllByExerciseIdWithEagerStudents -  Returns all teams for an exercise with eager students.
Optional<Team> findOneWithEagerStudents - Returns one team with eager students.
List<User> searchByLoginOrNameInGroup - Searches for users in a group (course) by their login or fullname (used for finding students to add to a team).

Service: Team

Team save(Exercise exercise, Team team) - Wrapper around the repository method that ensures that there are no student team conflicts, i.e. no student is in more than one team per exercise. If there is a conflict, a StudentsAlreadyAssignedException is thrown that contains a list of all the student team conflicts (so that it can be nicely shown in the frontend where the conflicts are exactly).
List<TeamSearchUserDTO> searchByLoginOrNameInCourseForExerciseTeam - Searches for students in a course and annotates each student with a flag whether this student is already assigned to a team for the given exercise. A custom DTO is used to only expose minimal information about the student as needed for the search operation. This will be used in the "add a student to team" search and select in the frontend.

Frontend: Team

New teams component that shows a table of all teams for an exercise (route: /exercise/:exerciseId/teams)
New dialog component to create and update a team
2.1. New team student search component that lets the user search for students and select them to add them to the current team
New partial team-config-form-group that is included in all the exercise update forms and renders the team assignment related settings (such as the exercise mode button that allows switching to team mode and the assignment related settings such as min and max team size)
New button "Teams" in each team-based exercise row in the exercise overview for a course. Clicking on it goes to /exercise/:exerciseId/teams for managing the teams.

Screenshots


Team assignment configuration in create/update exercise form. The default exercise mode is Individual. When the user switches to Team, additional fields become available. So far this is a range for the recommended team size. Valid min/max combinations are enforced immediately by increasing or decreasing the other value as soon as the user causes an invalid range.



Course Administration > Exercise overview for a course. A new button Teams is available for team-based exercises. Clicking on it brings the user to the team management page for that exercise.



All Teams for an exercise. All students in a team are immediately visible in the overview itself (in the future, it should also possible to search for a team by searching for one of the team members). Teams can be created, edited and deleted.



Editing a team. It can be renamed and students can be added/removed.



If the recommended team size is currently not fulfilled, the alert is shown in a warning state. It also offers the option to explictly go against the team size recommendation. When this option is checked, the save button becomes enabled again and the team can be saved despite not meeting the recommendation.



The student search supports autocomplete and the user can search for either login or name. Disabled items are those students who are already part of another team for this exercise. They can not be selected. They still appear in the autocomplete though to avoid confusion ("Is the student already in a team or could he not be found for some other reason, e.g. by not being in the course?").



This scenario should not happen very often but there are situations where it can happen: If multiple TAs or instructors are forming teams at the same time, they might have selected the same students for their new teams. The first TA/instructor will be able to save his team of students but the others won't be able to since their teams contain students that now already belong to another team for this exercise. These conflicts are shown very transparently by marking those students who were already assigned to another team in red and adding an explanation text to the right in red that states to which team each of those conflicting students already belongs. The TA/instructor can then either remove the conflicting students or modify the conflicting teams (i.e. remove the students there so that he is able to form a new team with them).






Below outdated (2019-02-18) [for reference]
Data Model (UML)




Below outdated (2019-01-14) [for reference]
Description

Add fields to existing entity Exercise
1.1 Add field mode (ExerciseMode: INDIVIDUAL, TEAM), default: INDIVIDUAL
1.2 Add field teamScope (TeamScope: COURSE, EXERCISE), help text: the team scope defines if teams will be defined for this exercise specifically or if course-wide teams should be used
Add new entity Team
2.1 Add fields name (team name) and image (can be used for team profile image)
2.2 Add OneToMany relationship to TeamStudent(which is the join entity for team and student, since it needs more than just the two foreign keys, two bidirectional @OneToMany associations are used instead of one @ManyToMany association, more info here).
2.3 Add subentity CourseTeam (discriminator value: CT). It has a foreign key to a Course. A CourseTeam is a team that is valid for a whole course (this type of team will be used by an exercise if the teamScope of the exercise is COURSE).
2.4 Add subentity ExerciseTeam (discriminator value: ET). It has a foreign key to an Exercise. An ExerciseTeam is a team that is only valid for a specific exercise (this type of team will be used by an exercise if the teamScope of the exercise is EXERCISE).
Add new entity TeamStudent
3.1 This entity is the membership model of the conceptual ManyToMany relationship between Team and Student. It is used to hold extra information on the relationship itself between a team and a student.
3.2 Add fields createdBy, createdDate, lastModifiedBy, lastModifiedDate (this is done by extending the existing mapped superclass AbstractAuditingEntity). createdDate will be used to store the timestamp when a student joined a team. createdBy can be used to store the person who assigned the student into this team (could either be the system itself or an instructor/tutor). The modified columns do not serve a purpose as of now but could be useful in the future (if the membership entity gets additional fields, it can be tracked who modified those when).
3.3 Add subentity CourseTeamStudent (discriminator value: CTS). It has a foreign key to a Course. A CourseTeamStudent is member of a CourseTeam (see above). This foreign key is redundant in so far that the team itself also contains a reference to the course. It is only used to enforce a very important unique constraint on the db level: In the table TeamStudent, the combination [studentId, courseId] must be unique. Semantically this means that a student can only be part of one course-wide team per course.
3.4 Add subentity ExerciseTeamStudent (discriminator value: ETS). It has a foreign key to an Exercise. An ExerciseTeamStudent is member of an ExerciseTeam (see above). This foreign key is redundant in so far that the team itself also contains a reference to the exercise. It is only used to enforce a very important unique constraint on the db level: In the table TeamStudent, the combination [studentId, exerciseId] must be unique. Semantically this means that a student can only be part of one exercise-wide team per exercise.
Add subentity TeamParticipation (discriminator value: TP)
4.1 TeamParticipation is the equivalent of StudentParticipation (both extend Participation), just that it references a Team instead of a Student (User).
Add subentity ProgrammingExerciseTeamParticipation (discriminator value: PETP)
5.1 ProgrammingExerciseTeamParticipation is the equivalent of ProgrammingExerciseStudentParticipation, just that it extends TeamParticipation instead of StudentParticipation.

Data Model (UML)

New entities:

Team (ExerciseTeam, CourseTeam)
TeamStudent (ExerciseTeamStudent, CourseTeamStudent)
TeamParticipation

New enums:

ExerciseMode
TeamScope

Alternative Visualization

Interactive version: here (alternatively see image below)
Usage:

Click Highlight at the bottom center to show multiplicity
Hover over a column of an enum type to show the possible enum values

Comments:

A green header color marks a new entity
Entities with id column correspond to actual database tables
Surrounding entities without id column are descendents of the root entity nearby with id column (for example: TeamParticipation extends Participation)
All entities of the same entity hierachy are stored in the same database table via STI
The set of columns of a database table is thus the union of all fields in the entity hierachy

nodes.bodyText: You can use primitive bool here
I believe this should not be necessary.
PUT mapping should have an id that you refer to https://restfulapi.net/resource-naming/
You can change all path variables to primitive types, as they can't be null anyways.

commit.message:
Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/develop' into feature/team-based-exercises/models

# Conflicts:
#	src/test/java/de/tum/in/www1/artemis/util/ModelFactory.java
Further model development (artemis.jh still needs adaptations to these changes)
Add team scope to toString method
Add fields "mode" and "teamScope" to programming exercise update component
Make TeamStudent an AbstractAuditingEntity (to be able to tell when a student has join a team and to be able to tell who assigned them into a team if a user did that)

nodes.bodyText: This and methods below are completely duplicated from StudentParticipation class. Can we avoid this?
I guess here you can set the default value, so you will not have to set in the test helper classes. Also as far as I understand it can't be set to null.
All the methods below copy the ones from ProgrammingExerciseStudentParticipation. Can you move them out to a separate class and use them in both classes?

commit.message: Simplification: simply models as discussed with Stephan
Code sharing in new abstract class ParticipantParticipation
Cast to StudentParticipation (TeamParticipation will be considered later)

nodes.bodyText: Can there be any other exercise modes besides team or individual in the future. Otherwise, we might only need a boolean here.

Yes, but we could still solve this problem. Java has default interface methods, which were originally introduced in order to provide backwards compatibility when adding new methods to interfaces. Normally, one should use an abstract class in most cases for default implementations. However, since we already have this interesting "ProgrammingExerciseParticipation interface solution" here, you could move all of this code into default methods in the interface.

commit.message: Get rid of ParticipantParticipation, move shared methods from StudentParticipation into Participation
Add new frontend entities (consequences of that are WIP)
